title: David Schwimmer parties in NYC with his pals Liev Schreiber and Gina Gershon
text:
David Schwimmer looked to be in great spirits on Thursday evening.

The 52-year-old actor wore a cap and blazer as he spent time with his longtime pals Liev Schreiber and Gina Gershon when attending Katrina Pavlos' Grand Classics event in New York City where Mark Ronson screened the film The King Of Comedy.

This comes days after he appeared in a Friends reunion photo shared by Jennifer Aniston which broke Instagram.

His other pals: David Schwimmer looked to be in great spirits on Thursday evening when he attended Katrina Pavlos' Grand Classics event in NYC

Chums: The 52-year-old actor wore a cap and blazer as he spent time with his longtime pals Liev Schreiber and Gina Gershon

The Friends photo featured Schwimmer, Aniston, Matthew Perry, Matt LeBlanc, Courteney Cox and Lisa Kudrow.

Aniston used the image to announce she had officially joined Instagram - she has been promoting her new Apple+ series The Morning Show with Reese Witherspoon.

But the Friends crew aren't his only buddies. He also has several celebrity pals in NYC.

Back together: The Friends photo featured Schwimmer, Aniston, Matthew Perry, Matt LeBlanc, Courteney Cox and Lisa Kudrow

Back on TV: Aniston used the image to announce she had officially joined Instagram - she has been promoting her new Apple+ series The Morning Show with Reese Witherspoon

Time to watch a classic: Here Schwimmer and Pavlos are seen with the dapper Petter Neby, founder of Punkt

David went casual in a cap with a denim jacket over a plaid shirt as he posed with Pavlos who was stylish in a grey blazer over a blue and red shirt.

The hosts of the event were Ronson, Petter Neby, Founder & CEO of Punkt., and Katrina, Founder of Grand Classics.

They welcomed guests including Chiara Clemente, Amanda Demme, Ann Dexter-Jones, Gina Gershon, Gregg Bello, Josh Hamilton, artist JR, Genevieve Jones, Naeem Juwan and Liev.

Beautiful in blue: Gershon, best know for Showgirls and Face/Off, wore a fun blue suit over a sheer top

A good poise: Here the Bound actress was seen with the host of the night, Mark Ronson, who presented The King Of Comedy

Say howdy: From left, Josh Hamilton, Liev, Gina, Ann Dexter-Jones, and Ronson

Also there was Lucy Sykes Rellie and Euan Rellie, Sabine Heller and Amy Sacco.

Ronson chose for his Grand Classics screening the film The King of Comedy.

It is the 1983 satirical comedy directed by Martin Scorsese, starring Robert De Niro, Jerry Lewis, and Sandra Bernhard.

Three smart chicks: From left, Amanda Demme, Amy Sacco and Gershon

Introducing the film Ronson said, 'I discovered this film by accident in my early twenties.

'And with every minute watching it I just thought this is my favorite thing that ever existed?

'It's cringe comedy at its finest, so tense and horrible that it's hard to watch but so amazingly portrayed and acted you just can't not watch it.

At the bar: Lawyer and author Enrico Pellegrini posed with artist Leopoldo Gout who rocked a blue scarf

She is very loved! Pavlos got a kiss on the cheek from New Yorker Euan Rellie

A toast to a classic movie: Euan sat with his wife Lucy Sykes, a British-American entrepreneur, fashion executive and author, and another pal

'And if you like The Joker you'll definitely like this movie because you'll see this is the Joker backstory, back story!'

Following the screening, Mark was joined by friends and music, design, style, and film insiders at an intimate cocktail party.

Guests sipped on Bombay Sapphire craft cocktails including the signature drink of the evening, the King of Bombay Lemonade.
